alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 8:48PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cheyenne and southeastern Kimball Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 748 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near North Sterling Reservoir, or 15 miles north of Sterling, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sidney, Lodgepole, Gurley, Colton, Sunol, Brownson, Lorenzo and Sidney Airport. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 45 and 77. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
